episodes.title: SEMINAR 44 WOMEN'S EVERYDAY RESISTANCE IN LONG STANDING CULT LEADERS COMPARING #iran  #northkorea
episodes.description:
WOMEN'S EVERYDAY RESISTANCE IN LONG STANDING AUTHORITARIAN REGIMES WITH CULT LEADERS: COMPARING IRAN AND NORTH KOREA


The 44th online seminar of the Global South Network (GSN) International Interdisciplinary Online PhD in Progress Weekly Seminar Series Phase IV Jan-Dec 2025 took place on 5 November 2025 from 15:00 to 16:00. 

Hazel Yeoun Choi, PhD Researcher, School of Law and Politics, Cardiff University presented part of their PhD project " Women's Everyday Resistance in Long Standing Authoritarian Regimes with Cult Leaders-The Cases of Iran and North Korea"   

Dr Hyun-Joo Lim, Principal Academic in Sociology, School of Law and Society, Bournemouth University was the first discussant.

Dr Devran Gulel, Research Fellow, Faculty of Business and Law, University of Portsmouth was the second discussant.

Dr Moohyung Cho, Assistant Profession of Political Science at Ewha Womans University, Korea chaired the session.

GSN  is aimed at empowering people from, or focusing on, the Global South. As of today, it is the only international interdisciplinary network that organised around 70 knowledge exchange activities (including 4 international hybrid conferences, around150 high quality online PhD in Progress weekly panel-discussion seminars (Phase I (https://globalsouthnetwork.com/gsn-phd-in-progress-seminar-series/), Phase II (https://globalsouthnetwork.com/phase-ii/), and Phase III (https://globalsouthnetwork.com/international-weekly-phd-in-progress-seminar-series-phase-iii/)), 12 guest lectures of supreme court judges from different countries (https://globalsouthnetwork.com/global-south-network-guest-lecture-series/)), created a team of conveners, established an interdisciplinary advisory committee (https://globalsouthnetwork.com/gsn-advisory-committee-university-of-leicester/), activated the website (www.globalsouthnetwork.com) and YouTube channel (      https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFecQWLl_Zulbsp98idX5jA) , created editorial board of GSN blogs, organised thematic and geographic groups within GSN, launched GSN mentoring, completed two edited collections on judicial independence (https://www.routledge.com/Judicial-Independence-in-Transitional-Democracies/Reayat-Smith-Cho/p/book/9781032599830?srsltid=AfmBOoqu9UDdNiLqnuucrnyKs7UlSU0pXezlPsdBvxRZrXOCWGOIKjrP), and created opportunities of public engagement for academics from all backgrounds just over a year of the network's launch.
GSN is the world's only interdisciplinary international network that is of and by the Global South but for both the Global South and the Global North and made an unparalleled contribution to equality, diversity and inclusion by hosting the guest talks of judges of both the Supreme Constitutional Court of Palestine (https://globalsouthnetwork.com/the-supreme-constitutional-court-of-palestine-past-present-and-future/) and the Supreme Court of Israel (https://youtu.be/OdTQ3c8ZwL8) during the peak of the Middle East crisis. 70% of participants during the GSN activities since its launch in March 2023 were women.
